Module nl.naturalis.common
Package nl.naturalis.common

Class Morph<T>

java.lang.Object
nl.naturalis.common.Morph<T>
Type Parameters:
T - The type to which incoming values will be converted
public class Morph<T> extends Object
Performs a wide variety of type conversions. The conversions try to strike a balance between being lenient without becoming outlandish or contrived. This class is optionally used by the BeanWriter class to perform type conversions on the values passed to its set method.
Target Type Input Type Return Value Remarks
primitive null 0, 0L, false, '\0', etc. primitive default of the target type
T null null  
T extends T input input value returned as-is
primitive (e.g. float) wrapper (e.g. Float) (float) input simple cast of the input value
String byte[ ] new String(input, UTF_8)  
String char[ ] new String(input)  
String other input.toString()  
T[ ] U[ ] T[ ] morph U elements to T (recursive call)
T[ ] Collection>U> T[ ] morph U elements to T (recursive call)
T[ ] IntList T[ ] morph int elements to T (recursive call)
byte[ ] String input.getBytes(UTF_8)  
char[ ] String input.toCharArray()  
T[ ] U new T[] { convert(u, T.class) } single-element array (recursive call)
Collection<T>> U new T[] { convert(u, T.class) } single-element array (recursive call)
Author:
Ayco Holleman
